title: Account suspension coming up to the end of the season.
body:
The FAQ page needs to be updated to clarify this. 

Are the rules around suspension coming up to the end of the ranked season in terms of whether you receive the rewards or not the same as last year?

I keep coming across this quote everywhere.

"Yes, some players are ineligible for rewards because of negative in-game behavior. _**This applies only to the 2016 season**_. Here are the details:
Players with bans or chat restrictions active when the season ends are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
Players issued a ban of seven days or more in the three months prior to the end of the season (from August 7 on) are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
Players banned for boosting during the 2016 season remain ineligible for rewards.
Players who experienced fraud-related and erroneous bans will still be eligible.
All players will have another chance at future ranked season rewards."

replies.body:
The rules didn't actually change from 2015 to 2016 (or from 14 to 15 for that matter I don't believe), but it's worded that way to leave the door open to change if something new comes up or something in the punishment/reward systems changes.

As it is, you can expect the eligibility to remain pretty much the same. There isn't anything that has really changed all that much RE ranked rewards and punishments so I expect the requirements won't change either.
